A Dark Trace: Sigmund Freud on the Sense of Guilt
=================================================






In this Book
------------


![Cover thumbnail for A Dark Trace](/book/24372/image/front_cover?format=180)
[Additional Information](#info_wrap)


### A Dark Trace: Sigmund Freud on the Sense of Guilt


Book
Herman Westerink

2021

Published by:
[Leuven University Press](/search?action=browse&limit=publisher_id:258)

Series:
[Figures of the Unconscious](/search?action=browse&limit=series_id:1626&min=1&max=10&t=series_facet_select)

* View
* [Save](/account/save/book:24372/non_js)
* [View Citation](/view_citations?type=book&id=24372)


[![Creative Commons License](https://i.creativecommons.org/l/by-nc-nd/4.0/88x31.png)](http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/)

This work is licensed under a [Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives 4.0 International License](http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/).


[![buy this book](/images/icon_book.png)
Buy This Book in Print](http://upers.kuleuven.be/en/book/9789058677549)

summary

Sigmund Freud, in his search for the origins of the sense of guilt in individual life and culture, regularly speaks of ‚Äúreading a dark trace‚Äù, thus referring to the Oedipus myth as a myth on the problem of human guilt. The sense of guilt is indeed a trace that leads deep into the individual‚Äôs mental life, into his childhood life, and into the prehistory of culture and religion. In this book this trace is followed and thus Freud‚Äôs thought on the sense of guilt as a central issue in his work is analyzed, from the earliest studies on the moral and ‚Äúguilty‚Äù characters of the hysterics, via the later complex differentiations in the concept of the sense of guilt, unto the analyses of civilization‚Äôs discontents and Jewish sense of guilt. The sense of guilt is a key issue in Freudian psychoanalysis, not only in relation to other key concepts in psychoanalytic theory, but also in relation to debates with others, such as Carl Gustav Jung or Melanie Klein, Freud was engaged in.




Table of Contents
-----------------

* [![PDF icon](/images/pdf.png)
  Download Full Book](/pub/258/oa_monograph/book/24372/pdf)

pp. 175-206

pp. 207-228

pp. 229-274

pp. 275-296

pp. 297-302

pp. 303-314

pp. 315-320
